page.title: 12Customs: Beating the Bounds
page.content: We live very close to the market town of Helston and are involved in many of the things which take place there. One ancient custom which we are invited to is {Beating the Bounds. }We follow the boundary between the Parish of Helston and our Parish of Wendron. When we reach a boundary stone, made from granite, which is {hard}, the people are turned upside down and their heads are bumped on the stone three stones. This is so that they will remember where they are! We then beat the stone with sticks. All this takes place on Ascension Eve and used to be led by the Cross and the Church Choir, but not any longer.
